metadata.title: Supabase Email and Password Auth Flow on Login and Signup Pages
metadata.prd_reference: Auth onboarding/login flows and multi-user access

context.background: User wants standard email/password authentication instead of Google OAuth for Healio login/signup setup.

design_constraints.constraint: Preserve calm in-page auth UX and explicit error states.
Keep local provisioning preview and onboarding flows usable for implementation/demo scenarios.
Do not regress safe `next` path handling in auth pages.

instruction.step: Replace Google OAuth actions on login/signup pages with email/password auth actions using Supabase browser client.
Add necessary password inputs and validation messaging (e.g., required password / confirm mismatch on signup).
Keep magic-link and local provisioning flows unless they conflict with email/password support.
Use Chrome DevTools MCP to verify `/login` and `/signup` render the email/password flows and no console errors occur.

validation_checklist.check: Signup page supports Supabase `signUp` with email and password.
Google OAuth CTA is removed from auth pages.
Typecheck passes and Chrome DevTools MCP verification is recorded.

acceptance_criteria.criterion: Users can initiate standard email/password auth on `/login` and `/signup` without Google OAuth dependency.
Task XML is updated with evidence and renamed `DONE_` on completion.

output_spec.commit_message: feat(healio-auth): add supabase email password auth on auth pages

evidence.item: Record auth UI changes, Supabase methods used, typecheck result, MCP verification notes, and commit refs.

execution_tracking.completion_signal: Task is done only when state=DONE, is_done=true, completed_at is filled, verification_status=PASSED, and evidence is recorded.

references.verification_tool: Chrome DevTools MCP (required for frontend task verification)
